name: Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with feet on the floor
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Unrack the bar and lower it to mid-chest
Press the bar back up to lockout
tips: Keep your shoulder blades retracted
Drive through your feet for stability

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie flat on a bench holding dumbbells at chest level
Press dumbbells up until arms are extended
Lower dumbbells back to chest level with control
tips: Allows greater range of motion than barbell
Keep wrists straight throughout

name: Push-Ups
instructions: Start in a high plank position
Lower your body until chest nearly touches the floor
Push back up to starting position
tips: Keep your core tight and body in a straight line
Modify on knees if needed

name: Incline Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
Grip barbell slightly wider than shoulders
Lower bar to upper chest
Press back to lockout
tips: Targets upper chest fibers
Don't set incline too steep or shoulders take over

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
Hold dumbbells at shoulder level
Press dumbbells up and slightly together
Lower with control
tips: Great for upper chest development
Squeeze at the top

name: Cable Chest Flyes
instructions: Set cables at chest height
Step forward with one foot
Bring handles together in front of chest in a hugging motion
Slowly return to start
tips: Focus on squeezing the chest
Keep a slight bend in elbows

name: Dumbbell Flyes
instructions: Lie flat on bench with dumbbells above chest
Open arms wide with slight elbow bend
Lower until you feel a stretch in the chest
Bring dumbbells back together
tips: Don't go too heavy â€” this is an isolation move
Think of hugging a large tree

name: Chest Dips
instructions: Grip parallel bars and lift yourself up
Lean forward slightly
Lower body by bending elbows until shoulders are below elbows
Push back up to starting position
tips: Lean forward to target chest more
Keep it slow and controlled

name: Machine Chest Press
instructions: Sit in the machine with back flat against pad
Grip handles at chest height
Push handles forward until arms are extended
Return slowly to start
tips: Great for beginners learning the pressing motion
Adjust seat height so handles align with mid-chest

name: Pull-Ups
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with overhand grip
Pull yourself up until chin is over the bar
Lower yourself with control
tips: Engage your lats, don't just use arms
Use a band for assistance if needed

name: Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit at lat pulldown machine
Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width
Pull bar down to upper chest
Slowly return to start
tips: Don't lean back excessively
Squeeze shoulder blades together at bottom

name: Barbell Bent-Over Row
instructions: Hold barbell with overhand grip
Hinge at hips to about 45 degrees
Pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen
Lower with control
tips: Keep back flat, don't round your spine
Drive elbows back, not just pulling with arms

name: Dumbbell Single-Arm Row
instructions: Place one knee and hand on a bench
Hold dumbbell in the other hand
Pull dumbbell to hip, squeezing shoulder blade
Lower with control
tips: Keep torso parallel to the floor
Focus on pulling with your back, not your arm

name: Seated Cable Row
instructions: Sit at cable row machine with feet on platform
Grab V-bar handle
Pull handle to abdomen, squeezing shoulder blades
Extend arms back slowly
tips: Don't swing your torso
Keep chest up throughout

name: T-Bar Row
instructions: Straddle the T-bar or landmine attachment
Grip the handle and hinge at hips
Pull the weight toward your chest
Lower with control
tips: Keep a neutral spine
Great for building back thickness

name: Face Pulls
instructions: Set cable at face height with rope attachment
Pull rope toward face, separating hands
Squeeze rear delts and upper back
Return slowly
tips: Excellent for posture and shoulder health
Keep elbows high

name: Resistance Band Pull-Aparts
instructions: Hold band at shoulder height with arms extended
Pull band apart by squeezing shoulder blades
Return to start with control
tips: Great warm-up exercise
Keep arms straight throughout

name: Overhead Press (Barbell)
instructions: Stand with barbell at shoulder height
Press bar overhead until arms are fully extended
Lower bar back to shoulders with control
tips: Brace your core throughout
Don't lean back excessively

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Sit or stand with dumbbells at shoulder height
Press dumbbells overhead
Lower back to shoulder height
tips: Seated version reduces momentum
Don't clank dumbbells at the top

name: Arnold Press
instructions: Start with dumbbells in front of face, palms facing you
Rotate palms outward as you press overhead
Reverse the rotation on the way down
tips: Hits all three delt heads
Use moderate weight for proper rotation

name: Pike Push-Ups
instructions: Start in downward dog position with hips high
Bend elbows and lower head toward the floor
Push back up to start
tips: Great bodyweight alternative for OHP
Place feet on bench for added difficulty

name: Lateral Raises
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at your sides
Raise arms out to the sides until parallel to floor
Lower slowly back to sides
tips: Don't swing â€” use lighter weight with strict form
Lead with elbows, not hands

name: Cable Lateral Raises
instructions: Stand beside a low cable with handle in far hand
Raise arm out to the side until parallel to floor
Lower slowly
tips: Constant tension throughout the movement
Better muscle engagement than dumbbells for some

name: Front Raises
instructions: Stand with dumbbells in front of thighs
Raise one or both arms straight in front to shoulder height
Lower with control
tips: Targets the anterior deltoid
Alternate arms to reduce fatigue

name: Reverse Pec Deck
instructions: Sit facing the pad on the pec deck machine
Grip handles and open arms wide
Squeeze rear delts at end range
Return with control
tips: Targets rear delts which are often neglected
Keep a slight bend in elbows

name: Barbell Back Squat
instructions: Place bar on upper back/traps
Feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out
Squat down until thighs are parallel or below
Drive back up through heels
tips: Keep chest up and core braced
Don't let knees cave inward

name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell at chest level
Squat down keeping weight close to body
Push back up to standing
tips: Great for learning squat mechanics
Keep elbows inside knees at bottom

name: Bodyweight Squats
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Extend arms in front for balance
Squat down until thighs are parallel
Stand back up
tips: Master this before adding weight
Perfect for high-rep conditioning

name: Leg Press
instructions: Sit in leg press machine with feet shoulder-width on platform
Release safety and lower platform toward chest
Press back up without locking knees
tips: Don't let lower back round off the pad
Foot placement changes emphasis

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: Stand lunge-length in front of a bench
Place rear foot on the bench behind you
Lower until front thigh is parallel to floor
Drive back up through front heel
tips: Excellent for fixing leg imbalances
Keep torso upright

name: Walking Lunges
instructions: Step forward into a lunge
Lower until both knees are at 90 degrees
Push off front foot and step forward with the other leg
Continue alternating
tips: Keep torso upright
Add dumbbells for extra resistance

name: Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Hold barbell with overhand grip at hip level
Hinge at hips, pushing them back
Lower bar along legs until you feel a hamstring stretch
Drive hips forward to return to start
tips: Keep bar close to your body
Slight knee bend â€” this is a hip hinge, not a squat

name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs
Hinge at hips, pushing them back
Lower dumbbells along legs
Return to standing by driving hips forward
tips: Good alternative if barbells aren't available
Focus on the hip hinge pattern

name: Leg Curl (Machine)
instructions: Lie face down on leg curl machine
Hook ankles under the pad
Curl pad toward glutes
Lower with control
tips: Isolates the hamstrings
Don't let hips come off the pad

name: Leg Extension (Machine)
instructions: Sit in leg extension machine
Hook ankles under the pad
Extend legs until straight
Lower with control
tips: Isolates the quadriceps
Don't use momentum

name: Calf Raises
instructions: Stand on edge of a step with heels hanging off
Rise up onto toes as high as possible
Lower heels below step level for a stretch
Repeat
tips: Slow and controlled reps work best
Add weight with dumbbells as needed

name: Seated Calf Raise
instructions: Sit in seated calf raise machine
Place balls of feet on platform
Release safety and rise up onto toes
Lower with control
tips: Targets the soleus muscle specifically
Pause at the top for peak contraction

name: Barbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand with barbell at arm's length, palms facing forward
Curl bar up by bending elbows
Squeeze biceps at the top
Lower with control
tips: Keep elbows pinned to your sides
Don't swing the weight

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms facing forward
Curl both dumbbells up simultaneously
Lower with control
tips: Can alternate arms for variety
Supinate wrist at the top for extra contraction

name: Hammer Curls
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms facing each other
Curl dumbbells up maintaining neutral grip
Lower with control
tips: Targets brachialis and forearms more
Great for arm thickness

name: Cable Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand facing a low cable with straight bar attachment
Curl bar up to chest level
Lower slowly
tips: Constant tension from the cable
Great finisher for biceps

name: Chin-Ups
instructions: Hang from bar with underhand grip, shoulder-width
Pull yourself up until chin clears the bar
Lower with control
tips: Great compound bicep exercise
Use a band for assistance if needed

name: Tricep Pushdown
instructions: Stand at cable machine with rope or bar attachment at top
Push handle down by extending elbows
Squeeze triceps at bottom
Return to start
tips: Keep elbows pinned to sides
Don't lean into it

name: Skull Crushers
instructions: Lie on bench with barbell or EZ bar overhead
Lower bar toward forehead by bending elbows
Extend arms back to start
tips: Keep upper arms stationary
Use an EZ bar for wrist comfort

name: Overhead Tricep Extension
instructions: Hold one dumbbell with both hands behind head
Extend arms overhead
Lower dumbbell behind head by bending elbows
Extend back up
tips: Keep elbows pointing forward
Great stretch on the long head of triceps

name: Diamond Push-Ups
instructions: Get in push-up position with hands together forming a diamond
Lower chest toward hands
Push back up
tips: Amazing bodyweight tricep exercise
Keep elbows close to body

name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit on bench, rest elbow on inner thigh
Curl dumbbell up toward shoulder
Squeeze bicep at top
Lower with control
tips: Great for isolating the bicep peak
No swinging possible in this position

name: Plank
instructions: Get into forearm plank position
Keep body in a straight line from head to heels
Hold the position, breathing steadily
tips: Don't let hips sag or pike up
Engage glutes and quads too

name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie on back with arms extended toward ceiling
Lift knees to 90 degrees
Extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously
Return and repeat on other side
tips: Press lower back into the floor
Excellent for core stability without back strain

name: Bicycle Crunches
instructions: Lie on back with hands behind head
Bring one knee toward chest while rotating torso
Touch opposite elbow to knee
Alternate sides in a pedaling motion
tips: Don't pull on your neck
Focus on the rotation, not just the crunch

name: Hanging Leg Raises
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar
Raise legs until thighs are parallel to floor (or higher)
Lower with control â€” don't swing
tips: Bend knees to make it easier
For advanced: raise legs all the way to the bar

name: Ab Wheel Rollout
instructions: Kneel on the floor holding ab wheel
Roll forward extending your body
Go as far as you can with control
Roll back to starting position
tips: Keep core tight â€” don't let back arch
Start with short rollouts and progress

name: Russian Twist
instructions: Sit with knees bent, feet slightly off the floor
Lean back slightly and clasp hands together
Rotate torso side to side
Touch hands to floor beside each hip
tips: Hold a weight for extra difficulty
Keep feet off the ground for more challenge

name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Start in high plank position
Drive one knee toward chest
Quickly switch legs
Continue alternating at a fast pace
tips: Keep hips level â€” don't bounce
Great for core + cardio

name: Cable Woodchop
instructions: Set cable at high position
Stand sideways to the machine
Pull handle diagonally across body from high to low
Control the return
tips: Rotate through your torso, not just your arms
Great for rotational core strength

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
instructions: Sit on floor with upper back against a bench
Roll barbell over hips
Drive hips up by squeezing glutes
Lower with control
tips: Best glute isolation exercise
Push through heels and squeeze at the top

name: Glute Bridge
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Drive hips up by squeezing glutes
Hold briefly at the top
Lower with control
tips: Bodyweight version of hip thrust
Great warm-up exercise

name: Cable Kickback
instructions: Attach ankle strap to low cable
Face the machine and kick one leg back
Squeeze glute at full extension
Return and repeat
tips: Don't arch your lower back
Focus on glute contraction, not just range of motion

name: Sumo Deadlift
instructions: Stand with wide stance, toes turned out
Grip barbell between legs
Squat down and grip the bar
Drive up by extending hips and knees
tips: Wide stance emphasizes glutes and inner thighs
Keep chest up throughout

name: Barbell Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width, bar over mid-foot
Hinge and grip bar just outside knees
Brace core and drive up by extending hips and knees
Stand tall, then lower with control
tips: Keep bar close to body throughout
Don't round your lower back

name: Kettlebell Swing
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulders, kettlebell on floor
Hike kettlebell back between legs
Drive hips forward explosively to swing kettlebell to chest height
Let it swing back and repeat
tips: Power comes from hips, not arms
Great for power and conditioning

name: Burpees
instructions: Start standing
Drop into a squat, place hands on floor
Jump feet back to plank position
Do a push-up, jump feet forward, then jump up with arms overhead
tips: Modify by stepping back instead of jumping
Great conditioning exercise

name: Thrusters
instructions: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height
Squat down
As you stand up, press dumbbells overhead in one fluid motion
Lower dumbbells back to shoulders as you squat again
tips: Combine squat and press seamlessly
Start light â€” these are deceptively hard

name: Clean and Press
instructions: Start with barbell on floor
Pull bar explosively to catch at shoulders (clean)
Press bar overhead
Lower to shoulders then back to floor
tips: Olympic lift â€” technique is crucial
Start with just the bar to learn the pattern
